marketNews.title: Coal imports by China and India rise in March 2024
marketNews.content: Commodity analyst firm Kpler recorded that coal imports by China and India increased in March 2024. During that period, China imported 29.7 million tons of coal (+29% month-on-month, +3.8% year-on-year), while India imported 15.21 million tons (+7.9% month-on-month, +13.4% year-on-year).

tickerNews.title: HRUM announces three corporate actions involving nickel assets and HPAL smelter acquisition
tickerNews.content: Harum Energy (HRUM) announced three corporate actions this week, each involving the acquisition of shares in nickel companies through loan conversion schemes. 1. Acquisition of 51% of PT Blue Sparking Energy (BSE) by HRUM through its subsidiary PT Tanito Harum Nickel (THN). HRUM converts a portion of a US$206.2 million loan into 1.04 million shares (51%) of BSE. Prior to this transaction, HRUM held no stake in BSE. BSE is developing a HPAL smelter with a capacity of 67,000 tons of nickel MHP and 7,500 tons of cobalt MHP per year at Weda Bay Industrial Park, targeted for commercial operation in 2026. 2. New share issuance in PT Harum Nickel Perkasa (HNP). HRUM acquires 8.48 million new HNP shares via a loan conversion worth approximately IDR 8.5 trillion (US$540 million). After the transaction, HRUM's ownership in HNP rises from 99.95% to 99.99%. The transaction aims to strengthen HNP's capital structure and expand HRUM's nickel business. 3. New share issuance in PT Tanito Harum Nickel (THN). HRUM, HNP and a third party PT Mahkota Emas Nickel (MEN) acquire 12.47 million new THN shares via a loan conversion worth about IDR 12.5 trillion (US$794.2 million). After the transaction, HRUM's stake in THN falls from 39.58% to 22.27%, HNP's stake rises from 60% to 77.52%, and MEN's stake declines from 0.42% to 0.21%. HNP and THN are HRUM subsidiaries that manage nickel businesses. Since 2020, HRUM has made several acquisitions in nickel through these subsidiaries. THN holds 51% of PT Position and 99.99% of PT Infei Metal Industry. HNP holds 80.7% of PT Westrong Metal Industry. Key Takeaway: Only the BSE transaction is judged to have a direct positive impact on HRUM fundamentals, as BSE adds a new nickel asset to the company. The THN and HNP transactions are considered to have limited impact because HRUM's effective ownership in these entities does not change significantly after the deals. Since announcing the BSE transaction on Monday (1/4) afternoon, HRUM's share price has risen 8.5% over the past two days. The loan conversion of approximately US$206.2 million for 51% of BSE implies a valuation of BSE at US$404.2 million (IDR 6.4 trillion). In early October 2023, HRUM through THN signed a loan facility agreement with BSE for US$500 million to develop the HPAL facility, of which US$300 million was disbursed on 17 October 2023. No detailed cost breakdown for the HPAL construction has been disclosed.

tickerNews.title: PTRO signs 9‑year mining services term sheet worth US$511.45 million with PT Pasir Bara Prima
tickerNews.content: Petrosea (PTRO) announced that it has signed a term‑sheet for a mining services agreement with PT Pasir Bara Prima, a subsidiary of Singaraja Putra (SINI). The contract is valued at US$511.45 million, has a duration of nine years until 2032, and is expected to strip 240 million cubic meters of overburden and produce 26.4 million tons of coal.

tickerNews.title: Chandra Asri Pacific secures IDR 4 trillion bullet loan from Bank Mandiri
tickerNews.content: Chandra Asri Pacific (TPIA) signed a bullet term‑loan facility worth IDR 4 trillion with Bank Mandiri (BMRI) for a tenor of seven years. The loan is intended to support the activities of the company's infrastructure investment entity, PT Chandra Daya Investasi.

tickerNews.title: Ace Hardware Indonesia targets 10% YoY sales growth in 2024 with 15‑20 new stores
tickerNews.content: Ace Hardware Indonesia (ACES) aims for a 10% year‑on‑year sales increase in 2024 and a 7% YoY growth in same‑store sales (SSSG). To achieve this, ACES plans to open 15‑20 new stores in 2024 with a capital expenditure of IDR 200‑250 billion, compared with IDR 300 billion in 2023. At the end of 2023, ACES operated 309 stores.

tickerNews.title: Bank CIMB Niaga to distribute 2023 dividend of approximately IDR 3.1 trillion
tickerNews.content: Bank CIMB Niaga (BNGA) will distribute a dividend for the 2023 fiscal year amounting to roughly IDR 3.1 trillion, or about IDR 122.7 per share. The dividend will be recorded in the regular and negotiated markets on 19 April 2024, with payment scheduled for 3 May 2024. Based on BNGA's closing price of IDR 2,080 per share on Wednesday (3/4), the implied dividend yield is 5.9%.

tickerNews.title: Hyundai ends aluminium purchase agreement with Adaro Minerals
tickerNews.content: Hyundai Motor (foreign ticker 005380) announced that it has terminated its aluminium purchase agreement with Adaro Minerals Indonesia (ADMR), a subsidiary of Adaro Energy Indonesia (ADRO). The agreement covered 50‑100 thousand tons of aluminium per year and expired at the end of 2023. ADMR's director, Wito Krisnahadi, confirmed the termination to Reuters and added that Hyundai decided not to renew the agreement after its expiry. Reuters reported that the decision was driven by pressure from K‑Pop fan‑based environmental activists urging the company to avoid sourcing metals from coal‑related companies.

tickerNews.title: Barito Renewables Energy completes acquisition of 99.99% of PT UPC Sidrap Bayu Energy and PT Operation and Maintenance Indonesia
tickerNews.content: Barito Renewables Energy (BREN), through its subsidiary PT Barito Wind Energy (BWE), has completed the acquisition of 99.99% of PT UPC Sidrap Bayu Energy (Sidrap 1) and PT Operation and Maintenance Indonesia (OMI). The total transaction value is US$102.2 million. After the acquisition, PT Barito Wind Energy owns the Sidrap 1 geothermal power plant with a capacity of 75 MW. BREN also signed a credit facility agreement with Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI) for US$110 million, of which US$70 million will finance the Sidrap 1 and OMI acquisitions and the remaining US$40 million will be used for general corporate purposes of BWE.

tickerNews.title: Trimegah Bangun Persada signs nickel ore sales agreement with PT Obi Nickel Cobalt
tickerNews.content: Trimegah Bangun Persada (NCKL), together with its subsidiary PT Gane Permai Sentosa, signed a nickel ore sales agreement with the association entity PT Obi Nickel Cobalt (ONC). The contract duration is one year until 28 March 2025; the sales volume was not disclosed. ONC is building a HPAL smelter with a capacity of 65,000 tons of nickel MHP per year, targeted to start operations in mid‑2024.

tickerNews.title: Vale Indonesia targets 70.8 thousand tons of nickel matte production in 2024
tickerNews.content: The Head of Communication of Vale Indonesia (INCO), Bayu Aji, stated that the company targets nickel matte production of 70.8 thousand tons in 2024, which is almost unchanged from the 2023 realization of 70.7 thousand tons.

tickerNews.title: Bank Maybank Indonesia to distribute 2023 dividend of IDR 784.5 billion
tickerNews.content: Bank Maybank Indonesia (BNII) will distribute a dividend for the 2023 fiscal year amounting to IDR 784.5 billion, or IDR 10.3 per share. The dividend will be recorded in the regular and negotiated markets on 17 April 2024, with payment scheduled for 30 April 2024. Based on BNII's closing price of IDR 258 per share on Wednesday (3/4), the implied dividend yield is 4%.

tickerNews.title: Panca Budi Idaman plans 1:4 stock split, to be discussed at AGM on 13 May 2024
tickerNews.content: Panca Budi Idaman (PBID) plans to execute a 1:4 stock split, with the last trading day of the old nominal value scheduled for 30 May 2024. The plan will be discussed at the General Meeting of Shareholders on 13 May 2024.
